record.options: ['$OR= (80/110) × (2/36) = 13.1$', 'A temporal association between smoking and oral diseases can be established', 'The chi-square test method can be used for statistical processing', 'Selection bias will overestimate the effect', 'Exposure and non-exposure equivalence might occur']
record.prompt:
A hypothetical study investigates the association between reducing smoking and oral diseases among professional baseball players. During spring training, interviewers asked each athlete about their past and current smoking status, as well as their alcohol consumption, history of dental diseases, and oral mucosal injuries. record.question: In primates, the skin surfaces of palms and soles that grasp objects have raised skin ridges. These ridges have several characteristics, which are permanent after the formation in the womb. Human fingertip patterns can generally be divided into three types: loops, whorls, and arches. At the base of the first joint of the finger, there is a point from which ridges radiate in three directions, known as the triradius. Loop patterns have no triradius, whorl patterns have one triradius, and arch patterns have two triradii. The number of ridges from the triradius to the center of the whorl or arch is called the finger ridge count (FRC). The total finger ridge count (TFRC) is the sum of the larger of the two numbers of ridge counts of all ten fingertips’ whorl and/or arch patterns. The table below shows the frequency distribution of the total finger ridge count of the Bai ethnic group in Dali. What type of data is this?<image_1>
record.options: ['Total finger ridge count is count data', 'Total finger ridge count is quantitative data', 'Total finger ridge count is qualitative data']
record.prompt:
